intro: Maerua meyeri-johannis, commonly known as the African glorybower, is a shrub native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Capparaceae and is characterized by its upright growth habit and showy, yellow-orange flowers. The plant has small, pinnately compound leaves and produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
